meanings.definition: Arranged in a sequence or series.
meanings.sent1: The books on the shelf were ordered by size.
meanings.sent2: The numbered list was ordered from smallest to largest.
meanings.sent3: The ordered arrangement of colors made the painting look neat.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an ordered line of soldiers, each one following the next.
meanings.sent5: The alphabet is an ordered way to organize letters.

meanings.sent1: She ordered a pizza for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The general ordered his troops to advance.
meanings.sent3: I ordered the clouds to move aside, but they didn't listen.
meanings.sent4: The teacher ordered silence in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: He ordered a new book online and waited eagerly for its arrival.

meanings.sent1: The ordered files made it easy to find the document.
meanings.sent2: The ordered layout of the website was user-friendly.
meanings.sent3: The ordered chaos of the artist's studio inspired creativity.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an ordered maze of thoughts, each leading to the next.
meanings.sent5: The ordered rows of trees created a peaceful atmosphere in the garden.
